item.title: Jeana add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Every man with a little leisure and enough money for railway tickets, every man, indeed, who knows how to read, has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jeana add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: Jeana add a quote by John August
item.description: "A little nonsense now and then, Is cherished by the wisest men." -- John August

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "The witching hour, somebody had once whispered to her, was a special moment in the middle of the night when every child and every grown-up was in a deep deep sleep, and all the dark things came out from hiding and had the world all to themselves." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Love is finding that the things you like best about yourself are not in you at all, but in the person who completes you" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "She will look at you as women look at men, and she will judge you as a woman judge men...not on the strength of their arguments, and not in their cleverness or prowess in battle, but rather on the force of their character, the intensity of their passion, their strength of soul, their compassion, and...ah, this above all...their conversation." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "I will not play at tug o' war. I'd rather play at hug o' war, Where everyone hugs Instead of tugs, Where everyone giggles And rolls on the rug, Where everyone kisses, And everyone grins, And everyone cuddles, And everyone wins." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Mark Mills
item.description: "When they start killing the men of ideas, you can be sure the Devil is laughing." -- Mark Mills

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Mark Mills
item.description: "Things can make sense at the time, but as you get older those consolations no longer help you sleep. It's the only thing I've learned. We all think we know the answer, and we're all wrong. Shit, I'm not sure we even know what the question is." -- Mark Mills

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our separate ways, I to die, and you to live. Which of these two is better only God knows." -- Socrates

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Mark Mills
item.description: "It's the job of old people to disapprove of everything young people do. . .If we don't disapprove, then the young have nothing to fight against and the world will never change. It cannot move on." -- Mark Mills

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Jeana add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Katherine Paterson
item.description: "Reading can be a road to freedom or a key to a secret garden, which, if tended, will transform all of life." -- Katherine Paterson

item.title: Jeana add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeana add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeana add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeana add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "There are some ideas so absurd that only an intellectual could believe them." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "It was not generally realized that what children mostly wanted was to be left alone." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "Hindus, in their capacity for love, are indeed hairless Christians, just as Muslims, in the way they see God in everything, are bearded Hindus, and Christians, in their devotion to God, are hat wearing Muslims." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description:
"One might even argue that if an animal could choose with intelligence, it would opt for living in a zoo, since the major difference between a zoo and the wild is the absence of parasites and enemies and the abundance of food in the first, and their respective abundance and scarcity in the second. Think about it yourself. Would you rather be put up at the Ritz with free room service and unlimited access to a doctor or be homeless without a soul to care for you?...
But I don't insist. I don't mean to defend zoos. Close them all down if you want (and let us hope that what wildlife remains can survive in what is left of the natural world). I know zoos are no longer in people's good graces. Religion faces the same problem. Certain illusions about freedom plague them both." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "These people fail to realize that it is on the inside that God must be defended, not on the outside. They should direct their anger at themselves. For evil in the open is but evil from within that has been let out. The main battlefield for good is not the open ground of the public arena but the small clearing of each heart." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none" -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Jeana add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The changes we dread most may contain our salvation." -- Barbara Kingsolver
